comments.body: I think that certain features in the End DLC should be separated into separate biomes. For example, there could be a biome for the mud springs, a biome for the void blocks/fluid, and a biome for the yellow grass.
Voted. That could be difficult to make look good, but there is currently only one biome with boulders (the mega taiga). It would be nice to have more rocky places.

Upvote, I was thinking about this with the new generation in the last couple experimental snapshots.

It would be cool to have some shallower water with rocks jutting up, or even rare tide pools with coral that can spawn in them.

actualmente hay playas de roca y de arena, fueron añadidos en la 1.18 experimental 2, si buscas bien en las costas de los océanos tendrás probabilidades de encontrar una playa de roca o de arena.

desde ya muchas gracias <3 

 

See below for English translation

‎currently there are rock and sandy beaches, they were added in the 1.18 experimental 2, if you look well on the shores of the oceans you will be likely to find a rock or sandy beach.‎

‎from now on thank you very much <3‎

 

-Translated by admin
Me gusta la idea
I say we just update the terrain generation of the current desert to have dunes instead of making a new sub biome

I think there should be the current desert, sand dunes, harsh desert (Death Valley), salt flats (Bonneville Salt Flats)(New Halite block?), rocky desert (Gobi Desert), and lush desert (Sonoran Desert).
I was thinking of the same idea.
Yo votaría por la del campo de hongos o jungla
Add an aqua biome

The End is rather sparse... other than Endstone and Chorus Plants, there's pretty much nothing. Ores would be a nice addition.

I don't think they should have "Enderite" that's just a copy of Netherite, which would be unoriginal. Besides, they just recently added a new ore stronger than the previously strongest material, so they shouldn't do it again so soon.

Perhaps End Amethyst ore? It could drop Amethyst Shards.

I likes 

I need that EndGold
This was actually a feature in Minecraft Alpha versions; it was removed though, in favor of biomes.
I think that ALL biomes need to experience the seasons as they would in real life, like winter in snow biome looks the same but in grass planes it snows

Pour la mémoire sur console son va être astronomique et 4 dimension est trop ne pas oublier les serveurs le plus gros problème de Minecraft si bonne idée mais son irait plus en mode on aurait adapté plus

Amazing idea
I think the claw making the knife is unnecessary, you can make knives in many different ways. The knife could also be used to consistent apples from trees in other biomes as well.
The end is pretty much a space dimension, you can fall off into nothingness and the small outer islands are like asteroids.
Si es tomada la idea por mojang se podria llamar la versión: "End city update"
Yeah Minecraft needs more varied shores.

More colorful building material is fun :D maybe the loose chalk can be used to make an item that can draw on any surface like IRL chalk.

somebody else made this cool post (that I cant find bc this site has terrible search functions >.<) for an item like this and chalk would be perfect for something like that. a multi-purpose material

This seems amazing, I actually live on a cliff and they're absolutely wonderful to go on a short walk to. Maybe there could also be a new flower variety that is especially hardy in real life, a flower I suggest for this would be armeria maritama which I often see on walks. I also see rabbits quite often on my cliff so maybe the spawnrate could be buffed in cliff biomes? Great idea.
I think polar bears, Strays, and penguins will appear there.

It would be cool if these generated in between high mountains, like in real life. Plus, with this, even if there aren't special new blocks or mobs, a more common source of ice, packed ice, and/or blue ice would be nice.
yes, fish could spawn in a 'evaporated' desert
maybe this could be a archeology hotspot with many fossils and stuff
they should make a megaladon boss hiding in the sand then fills the desert up with water that is 80 blocks deep and makes a boss fight having 200 health
What the heck!?
I really want a new biome and love  it
Comment and vote if u think this idea is good!!
Lions don't live in jungles
Would lions be like more evolved ocelots?
Yes they would be
Are there any monkeys in it
After the aquatic, nether and cave update: #ENDUPDATE!!!
Dunno about the crewed ship thing but I would agree with the enlargement part.

Oceans can be very large. Your experience of oceans is likely very different to other people’s, as it depends on your world seed. Larger shipwrecks would be cool, but pilotable boats would be too hard to implement.
I like this but what could these pirates do id like them to have a purpose

I agree that oceans should be larger. In general I think the terrain generation should create large continents that are surrounded and separated by even larger oceans. That way there's a clear delineation between different areas in a Minecraft world - as of now it just goes on forever as a patchwork of biomes - which makes navigating easier, forces you to at first make do with the biomes on the continent you spawned on, makes going exploring by crossing the ocean a big undertaking and makes creating a connection over seas between continents a project worth doing.

It' would be nice if this was combined with better rivers and more interesting ships, but that's another story.
#enderlakes

Very well organised post! Mojang is planning on an end update at some point, but it’s not a priority because such a small percentage of players actually reach the End, so it would not affect as many people as, say, a cave update. Cool ideas though! I see no problem with any of them, but I do think the ender fish, ender lily and chorus berries need unique uses. I know that ender lilies grow ender pearls in modded minecraft, but that doesn’t actually make sense because pearls are secreted by animals in real life. But hey, when was minecraft ever like real life...

Thank you! Are u a mojang developer? If so I thought of a few ideas for the ender lilies, fish, and berries,
Let’s say the berries act a lot
Like chorus fruit but they don’t always teleport you, and the berries can be made into a “chorus Berry block, or stem.
Ooh and for the ender Lily’s, they can be made into a suspicious stew and the stew will teleport you and give you levitation for 5 seconds but the levitation is weaker then a shulkers levitation

If I got this idea twice Srry it didn’t show for me when I updated my comment, but for the fish they should drop a new item called “ender shards” and it can be made into a “ender shard block” or a new item called “end city locator” if you combine 8 shards around and a map in the middle u will get a end city locator!

I’m not a Mojang Developer I’m afraid, but there is a lot of evidence of an ‘end update’ coming at some point - When Jeb was asked if any new dimensions were coming soon, he said that he’d like to add another one, but they will have to update the current ones first. The Nether was updated shortly after in the 1.16 update.
Estoy casi seguro de que eso ya pasa
if it does, not on all the Minecraft versions...
Esto ya sucede en la edición de base, pero aún no se ha implementado en la edición de JAva.

I am having the same issue.I just started the Bloom quest, I am in the garden, I found the 3 tools, and have the book. The book pretty much says to take clippings, prepare the ground then plant the clippings and water them. So I keep clipping the plants with the pruners and I am not getting any clippings. Neither can I prepare the ground! What am I doing wrong??
Yea, it won’t let you collect the clippings while doing the mine key. So I can’t get past to the next level
Yeah I can’t figure this out either. Have you figured anything out?
The left trigger or interaction button to collect clippings
I have collected the pruners.the shears. And the watering can. But I can't get the hatchet..
The hatchet is in the green house zone. Across the bridge. Near the tower you can upgrade. And the axe is in the maze. You’ll need you clippers to get to the maze in homestead.
Do you know wat is clippings
someone said left trigger but what about on mobile??
If your playing on mobile you need to tap on the land flowers instead of holding down on each plant. Hoped I helped :).
Use the clippers and use Lt instead of Rt if youre on xbox one to harvest clippings!
I’m dealing with this as well. I cheated to see if I can go around it and that works. But when you need to water your plants. It doesn’t work, none of the tools work.
So I got the clippings, but it wont let me use the trowel to prepare the dirt. Im on xbox, it says Rt to mine but does nothing. I'm at a loss. Help.
diffrent thing but i cant clip through the maze thingy
Guys press both top buttons simultaneously keep in mind I'm using ps4 controller x
(Xbox) Hold Right Trigger (RT) and then press Left Trigger (LT). Make sure it's a flowery plant!

Woolly rhinos would be sheared for fur which would be used to craft snow gear which is dyeable and protects from cold. Blizzards give all mobs except iceologers, snow golems, and strays, slowness and the powdered snow effect. Being in a snow biome gives players a slowed down powdered snow effect, but being near campfires, fires, lava, and magma will cause this to stop. Iceologers replace evokers in snowy raids. Horned helmets are crafted with an iron helmet and 2 goat horns and damage mobs when you sprint at them. You can scoop up snow in a bowl and eat it, but it makes you a little colder. You could also use that bowl of snow with sugar, dye, and paper to craft a snow cone
